items.sentence: No matter what happens, I\'m not changing my mind.
Old people aren\'t always wiser than young people.
Tom told Mary that the cake she baked tasted good.
Tom told his son not to speak with his mouth full.
Tom took the orange juice out of the refrigerator.
If there had been a problem, Tom would\'ve called.
Tom and Mary went for a walk in the park together.
Tom and Mary went on a picnic with John and Alice.
Tom and Mary went to the worst restaurant in town.
Tom and Mary were both wearing heavy winter coats.
Tom and Mary were just in time for the last train.
Tom and Mary were surprised to see John and Alice.
It won\'t be the first time that Tom\'s been late.
I don\'t want Tom making the same mistakes I made.
I don\'t want Tom to make the same mistake I made.
I don\'t want to be the person who tells Tom that.
I don\'t want to do that without the proper tools.
I don\'t want to sleep on the couch again tonight.
I don\'t want you to make the same mistake I made.
I can\'t believe it. Tom can\'t believe it either.
